data.title: Best beef BBQ in town
data.text: Well known old time restaurant with delicious BBQ. You won't be disappointed with anything from the menu. Cole slaw is great, too.

data.title: Best BBQ on the planet!
data.text: I've been to 22 countries and all 50 states and never had BBQ as good as Lindsey's.  So glad it is right here in my hometown and I've been eating their BBQ since I've had teeth.  The Lindsey family is very welcoming and the service is as good as the food.

data.title: THE BEST BBQ IN TOWN
data.text: This is our favorite pickup and take home bbq.  By calling ahead there is no wait.  I expecially love the link sandwich and the fried peach pies.  I have also eaten their catered meal and it was super.

data.title: Lindseys BBQ in North Little Rock, AR
data.text: Lindsey's is always excellent:  great BBQ, and delicious home cooking (cabbage, yams, black eyed peas, etc.)

data.title: Great Barbeque!
data.text: Great accommodations and food.  Great place for an informal wedding reception.  The people were friendly and accommodating.

data.title: Can't say enough good things
data.text: The food is amazing the service is spectacular!  My co-worker and I go at least once a month. It's always crowded people eating waiting to order food to go.  I looooooooooooove this place. Generous portions so you never leave hungry if you do its only of your own doing. Truly check them out. They are closed on Sundays so plan a visit Monday through Saturday.  You'll be thanked and more than likely get a handshake as they thank you for the business.

data.title: Decent Barbecue for Little Rock
data.text:
Lindsey's feels more like an old-school family restaurant than a true barbecue joint, but the smell of delicious pit smoke alleviated my concerns. Judging by the large lunch crowd, this place must be rather popular amongst the locals.

With no other multi-meat combos on the menu besides their gigantic family packs, I was left to create one of my own. I ordered a half-pound of chopped pork and a half-rack of pork ribs, with a side of potato salad. As soon as we sat down, I realized my mistake in not requesting sauce on the side for my ribs, so I dashed over to the kitchen and rectified that error. I suppose I could have requested the same for my chopped pork, but I decided to live dangerously today.

The potato salad was both creamy and delicious, with a good mustardy tang. It didn't have as much crunch as I would have liked from veggie mix-ins, but still very good.

Lindsey's big, meaty spare ribs were really juicy and awesomely tender. I found a great flavor on the crust, which thankfully wasn't overpowered by salt. The ribs had only a moderate smokiness, but it was an acceptable level. Only a slight tug was required to separate meat from bone, precisely as it should be.

The chopped pork was also tender as can be, and the few bites of bark that I found were extra flavorful. I'm not a big sauce fan in general, but Lindsey's vinegary-tomato barbecue sauce was quite tasty. It also added a nice acidity to the dish.

Lindsey's might be closer to 3.5 stars, but I was full of Christmas spirit and rounded up.

Read my full review, complete with pictures:

Search "The Barbecue Fiend"

data.title: Food is all ways delicious
data.text: I always enjoy myself when i eat in or carry out at this BBQ RESTAURANT. Front counter staff is always pleasant, informative of the menu and daily special. Love the chopped beef sandwich, it has me coming on a weekly basis.:)

data.title: Friendly folks
data.text: Stopped in to this hole in the wall for dinner.  Friendly counter person explained the menu and the process of ordering before seating.  Food arrived quickly. Ribs and the chicken were good. Loved the bbq sauce, just the right balance of smoke, tomatoes and spice. Pie was a bit saucy and not chunky enough. Good value.

data.title: Good lunch and really friendly people
data.text: I was in the area for business and decided to have lunch here. I ordered the chopped pork sandwich with beans and slaw. The sandwich and the beans were very good. I also shared some rib tips. I would say they were average at best. The restaurant was really clean and the staff was extremely friendly.

data.title: Would go back again.
data.text:
As we were traveling through I found this little place using trip advisor and I also used a groupon for it!  
The food was very good.  The service was friendly and quick. So much food I couldn't eat it all!  If passing through again, we will stop!
Beef BBQ plate with pinto beans and yams as side items. 
Pork BBQ plate with fried okra and peas as side items.

owner_response.author: Donnie L, Owner at Lindsey's Hospitality, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for stopping by! Hope to see you again on your next visit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best BBQ  Ever
data.text: Have been to many BBQ restaurants in both Arkansas and other states. Lindsey's rates as the best ever. We usually get a BBQ sandwich, potato salad and baked beans. Also last year I got several pounds of the chopped pork for a family occasion. The meat was as good as I have come to expect. We go often and have never been disappointed. The service and friendliness of the staff is also top-notch. Food and service has always been consistent.

owner_response.author: Donnie L, Owner at Lindsey's Hospitality, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your continued patronage! Hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best BBQ in Town
data.text: This is a great spot for barbecue in the Little Rock area. Also the lunch specials are delicious. I will be back.

owner_response.author: Donnie L, Owner at Lindsey's Hospitality, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for coming by! Will see you again soon
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Poor Service  - Here
data.text: The food here at this restaurant is not very consistent. Sometimes it is real good and then sometimes it is mediocre at best. The service is very poor. I went in for lunch and ordered my meal and sat down. My meal came reasonably fast but there was no drink or bread. In addition, I asked for sauce on the side and the meal came with sauce piled on the meat. The server took it back but returned with no drink and bread which I reminded her. I ate half of my meal and I saw another server and explained that I paid for and specified a drink with my meal and still did not have drink or bread. She was full of apologies but still not bread or drink came. The owner’s daughter and law came to the table to see if all was well but once again I had to complain that I had no drink and no bread. She never return. Finally a different server came by to get plates from some of the others in my group and some of them complained that I never got my drink or bread. She apologized and finally after I had eaten 95% of my meal my drink and bread arrived.

owner_response.author: Donnie L, Owner at Lindsey's Hospitality, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your candid opinion about our restaurant. We are so sorry for your disappointment during this visit and/or any other time that you may have frequented our restaurant. We sincerely apologize for your bread and drink not being served in a timely manner. We have taken the necessary steps to insure that a problem like this will not happen again to you or to any other of our valued customers. We, Donnie and Eleanor Lindsey (Owners), would appreciate the opportunity to address your concerns the next time you visit. We pride ourselves in quality food as well as quality service.  It is our hope that you will try us again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: the most wonderful soul and comfort food
data.text:
The food is all cooked to order and excellent. The greens and other vegetables come direct from the farm and are the freshest ever. The catfish is to die for. Fried, but very moist. Save room for desert.
But what is on par with the food is the service. Everyone is so friendly and kind. Wonderful people, wonderful service and wonderful food. A perfect Trifecta.

owner_response.author: Donnie L, Owner at Lindsey's Hospitality, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your review! We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: They just close a little to Early
data.text: My son and I went to Lindsey's and enjoy ourselves. We were not expecting it to be as Nice and the Food was delicious.

owner_response.author: Donnie L, Owner at Lindsey's Hospitality, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review! Just a little confused.....You stated that the food and Service was good, but you still gave us a low rating. Is this only because of our hours of operation? If there is more to your low rating, please contact us at your convenience so that we can be sure to address any concerns you may have. Thank you again for coming to see us.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious - Best greens I've had in a long time.
data.text: Awesome soul food! Had the catfish platter with greens and it was great. The staff was great and the place made me feel like I was at home in grandma's kitchen. Everything is made fresh to order. Will definitely visit again.

owner_response.author: Donnie L, Owner at Lindsey's Hospitality, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for coming by! Hope to see you again soon
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friendly, helpful staff
data.text: For some reason our GPS took us to a former location one block away, but we kept looking and I'm glad we did! Order at a counter just inside the door and the food is brought to your table.  Not busy at all a little early on a Saturday afternoon, but the staff were all friendly and asked if we needed anything every time one of them passed our table. Each of us had the sandwich special which included a side and drink for $6. Buns were extremely soft and flavorful. Great barbecue.

data.title: Good eating!
data.text:
This restraunt is historical in this area and has continued to serve quality food. They not only have good barbeque but delicious soul food and the best catfish!
There is a southern down home friendly atmosphere there also!
I highly recommend this as being one of your stops when you come to this area!

owner_response.author: Donnie L, Owner at Lindsey's Hospitality, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your continued patronage to our establishment! We appreciate your comments.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Down Home Cooking with Smile
data.text: Our family went to this restaurant for a late lunch on a summer holiday. The staff were unbelievably friendly and knowledgable. They made us feel like old family friends even though it was our first trip to this restaurant. They catfish was melt in your mouth good and so fresh that there was no "fishy" taste. The ribs my daughter ordered melted from the bone with every bite. The BBQ sauce was a well balanced mix of sweet, tart and spicy. The onion rings were a huge hit. Our best review has to be for the fried pies though. They were just as good as my grandma's...and that is saying a lot! All in all I would say this sixty year old family owned restaurant has a winning combination of food and friendliness. We will be back!

owner_response.author: Donnie L, Owner at Lindsey's Hospitality, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank for your kind words! We pride ourselves in quality of food and service. We are glad that it shows!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
